   1++CD3A              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2++CD3A
   3++CD3A 00           clipDx                  DB      0           ; also XX12+2
   4++CD3B 00           clipDxHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   5++CD3C 00           clipDxHighNonABS        DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   6++CD3D 00           clipDy                  DB      0           ; also XX12+4
   7++CD3E 00           clipDyHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+5
   8++CD3F 00           clipGradient            DB      0
   9++CD40 00           clipDxySign             DB      0
  10++CD41              varX12p3                equ     clipDxySign
  11++CD41 00           clipXGTY                DB      0
  12++CD42 00           clipFlags               DB      0
  13++CD43 00           SWAP                    DB      0
  14++CD44 00 00        varYX                   DW      0
  15++CD46              ;varRegX                 DB      0
  16++CD46              ;varXX12p2               DB      0
  17++CD46 00           clipXX13                 DB      0
  18++CD47
  19++CD47
  20++CD47              ; bounds check and the start to avoid dxy calcs if off screen, eliminating off screens first saves a lot of uncessary mul/div
  21++CD47              ;ClipXX15XX12Line:
  22++CD47 ED 4B 85 C0  ClipLine:               ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)          ; bc - XX15(2,3)
  23++CD4B DD 2A 89 C0                          ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)          ; ix - XX12(0,1)
  24++CD4F 2A 83 C0                             ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)          ; hl - XX15(0,1)
  25++CD52 ED 5B 87 C0                          ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)          ; de - XX15(4,5)
  26++CD56 AF                                   xor     a
  27++CD57 32 43 CD                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; SWAP = 0
  28++CD5A 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; A = X2Hi
  29++CD5B FD 26 BF     .LL147:                 ld      iyh,$BF                     ; we need to be 191 as its 128 + another bit set from 0 to 6, we are using iyh as regX
  30++CD5E                                      ;       push    af
  31++CD5E                                      ;       ld      a,iyh
  32++CD5E                                      ;       ld      (regX),a
  33++CD5E                                      ;       pop     af
  34++CD5E DD B4                                or      ixh                         ; if (X2Hi L-OR Y2 Hi <> 0) goto LL107             -- X2Y2 off screen
  35++CD60 20 0A                                jr      nz, .LL107
  36++CD62 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  37++CD64 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; if screen hight < y2 lo, i.e y2 lo >127 goto LL107,
  38++CD67 20 03                                jr      nz,.LL107
  39++CD69 FD 26 00                             ld      iyh, 0                      ; else iyh = regX = 0                                                                        -- X2Y2 on screen
  40++CD6C                                      ;        push    af
  41++CD6C                                      ;        ld      a,iyh
  42++CD6C                                      ;        ld      (regX),a
  43++CD6C                                      ;        pop     af
  44++CD6C              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  45++CD6C              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  46++CD6C FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  47++CD6E 32 46 CD                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  48++CD71 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  49++CD72 B0                                   or      b                           ;
  50++CD73 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  51++CD75 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  52++CD76 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  53++CD79 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  54++CD7B              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  55++CD7B FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  56++CD7D FE 00                                cp      0
  57++CD7F 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  58++CD81              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  59++CD81 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  60++CD82 32 84 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  61++CD85 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  62++CD87 32 86 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  63++CD8A 7D                                   ld      a,l
  64++CD8B 32 83 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  65++CD8E 7B                                   ld      a,e
  66++CD8F 32 85 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  67++CD92                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  67++CD92 B7          >                        or a
  68++CD93 C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  69++CD94              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  70++CD94 37           .PointsOutofBounds:     scf                                 ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  71++CD95 C9                                   ret
  72++CD96 FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  73++CD98 B7                                   or      a
  74++CD99 1F                                   rra
  75++CD9A FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  76++CD9C                                      ;        push    af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  77++CD9C                                      ;        ld      a,iyh               ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  78++CD9C                                      ;        ld      (regX),a            ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  79++CD9C                                      ;        pop     af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  80++CD9C FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  81++CD9E ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  82++CDA1 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  83++CDA3 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  84++CDA4 A2                                   and     d
  85++CDA5                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  85++CDA5 FA 94 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  86++CDA8 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  87++CDA9 DD A4                                and     ixh
  88++CDAB                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  88++CDAB FA 94 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  89++CDAE 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  90++CDAF 3D                                   dec     a
  91++CDB0 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  92++CDB2                                      ;        push    af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  93++CDB2                                      ;        ld      a,iyl              ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  94++CDB2                                      ;        ld      (varXX12p2),a      ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  95++CDB2                                      ;        pop     af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  96++CDB2 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  97++CDB3 3D                                   dec     a
  98++CDB4 FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  99++CDB6                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  99++CDB6 F2 94 CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 100++CDB9              ;by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
 101++CDB9 DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
 102++CDBB 3D                                   dec     a
 103++CDBC FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 104++CDBE 78                                   ld      a,b
 105++CDBF 3D                                   dec     a
 106++CDC0 FD B5                                or      iyl
 107++CDC2                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
 107++CDC2 F2 94 CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 108++CDC5 79                                   ld      a,c
 109++CDC6 DD A5                                and     ixl
 110++CDC8                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
 110++CDC8 FA 94 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
 111++CDCB              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 112++CDCB              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 113++CDCB              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 113++CDCB B7          >                        or a
 114++CDCC E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 115++CDCE EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 116++CDCF ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 117++CDD1                                     ; pop     de                          ; we need de back
 118++CDD1 22 3A CD                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 119++CDD4 7C                                   ld      a,h
 120++CDD5 32 3C CD                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 121++CDD8                                     ; ld      a,e                         ;a = x2 lo
 122++CDD8                                     ; sbc     a,l                         ;a= a - x1
 123++CDD8                                     ; ld      (clipDx),a
 124++CDD8                                     ; ld      a,d
 125++CDD8                                     ; sbc     a,h
 126++CDD8                                     ; ld      (clipDxHigh),a                ; later we will just move to sub hl,de
 127++CDD8                                     ; ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a          ; it looks liek we need this later post scale loop
 128++CDD8              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 128++CDD8 B7          >                        or a
 129++CDD9 DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 130++CDDC ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 131++CDDE 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 132++CDE0 22 3D CD                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 133++CDE3 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 134++CDE4                                     ; ld      a,ixl
 135++CDE4                                     ; sbc     c
 136++CDE4                                     ; ld      (clipDy),a
 137++CDE4                                     ; ld      a,ixh
 138++CDE4                                     ; sbc     a,b
 139++CDE4                                     ; ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 140++CDE4                                     ; pop     hl
 141++CDE4
 142++CDE4              ;So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 143++CDE4                                    ;  push    hl                          ; Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs
 144++CDE4 21 3B CD                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 145++CDE7 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 146++CDE8 32 54 9A                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 147++CDEB 32 40 CD                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 148++CDEE 3A 3E CD     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 149++CDF1 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 150++CDF4 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 151++CDF6 2A 3D CD                             ld      hl,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 152++CDF9                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 152++CDF9 AF          >					xor 	a
 152++CDFA 93          >                    sub 	e
 152++CDFB 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 152++CDFC 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 152++CDFD 92          >                    sub 	d
 152++CDFE 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 153++CDFF 22 3D CD                             ld      (clipDy),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 154++CE02 2A 3A CD     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 155++CE05 3A 3B CD                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 156++CE08 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 157++CE0B 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 158++CE0D                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 159++CE0D                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 159++CE0D AF          >					xor 	a
 159++CE0E 95          >					sub 	l
 159++CE0F 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 159++CE10 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 159++CE11 94          >					sub 	h
 159++CE12 67          >					ld 		h,a
 160++CE13                                     ; ld      (clipDx),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out; we still retain the old sign in NonABS version
 161++CE13              .LL111:               ;  push    de
 162++CE13                                     ; ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 163++CE13                                     ; ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 164++CE13 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 165++CE14 B2                                   or      d
 166++CE15 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 166++CE17
 167++CE17                                      ShiftDERight1
 167++CE17 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 167++CE19 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 168++CE1B                                      ShiftHLRight1
 168++CE1B CB 3C       >			   srl h
 168++CE1D CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 169++CE1F 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 170++CE21              .CalculateDelta:        ;ld      (clipDx),hl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 171++CE21                                      ;ld      (clipDy),de                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 172++CE21              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 173++CE21 AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 174++CE22 32 6E 9A                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 175++CE25 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 176++CE26                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 176++CE26 BB          >                        cp      e
 176++CE27 DA 37 CE    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 177++CE2A              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 178++CE2A 32 52 9A     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 179++CE2D 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 180++CE2E 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 181++CE2F CD 62 AC                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 182++CE32 32 53 9A                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 183++CE35 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 184++CE37              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 185++CE37 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 186++CE38 57                                   ld      d,a
 187++CE39 32 52 9A                             ld      (varQ),a
 188++CE3C 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 189++CE3D CD 62 AC                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 190++CE40 32 53 9A                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 191++CE43 21 6E 9A                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 192++CE46 35                                   dec     (hl)
 193++CE47 D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 194++CE48 E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 195++CE49 3A 53 9A                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 196++CE4C 32 3F CD                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 197++CE4F FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 198++CE51                                      ;       push    af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 199++CE51                                      ;       ld      a,iyl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 200++CE51                                      ;       ld      (varXX12p2),a        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 201++CE51                                      ;       pop     af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 202++CE51 3A 54 9A                             ld      a,(varS)
 203++CE54 32 40 CD                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 204++CE57                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 205++CE57 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 206++CE59 FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 207++CE5B 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 208++CE5D ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 209++CE60 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 210++CE62              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 211++CE62 CD 89 CE     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 212++CE65 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 213++CE67 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 214++CE6A 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 215++CE6C              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 216++CE6C 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 217++CE6D B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 218++CE6E C2 94 CD                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 219++CE71 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 220++CE72 FA 94 CD                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 221++CE75              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 222++CE75              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 223++CE75 EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 224++CE76 DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 225++CE78 C5                                   push    bc
 226++CE79 DD E1                                pop     ix
 227++CE7B C1                                   pop     bc
 228++CE7C CD 89 CE                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 229++CE7F 3A 43 CD                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 230++CE82 3D                                   dec     a
 231++CE83 32 43 CD                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 232++CE86 C3 81 CD     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 233++CE89
 234++CE89              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 235++CE89              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 236++CE89 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 237++CE8A ED 27 80                             test    $80
 238++CE8D 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 239++CE8F 32 54 9A     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 240++CE92 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 241++CE95 CD 0B CF                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 242++CE98                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 243++CE98                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 244++CE98 C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 245++CE9B 2A 44 CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 246++CE9E              ;                        ex      hl,de
 247++CE9E                                  ;    ld      hl,bc
 248++CE9E 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 249++CE9F 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 250++CEA1 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 251++CEA4               ;                       pop     de
 252++CEA4 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 253++CEA6 FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 254++CEA8 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 255++CEAA 3D                                   dec     a
 256++CEAB 32 54 9A                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 257++CEAE E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 258++CEB1 CD 0B CF                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 259++CEB4                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 260++CEB4                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 261++CEB4 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 262++CEB7                                    ;  push    de                          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 263++CEB7 2A 44 CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 264++CEBA                                    ; ex      de,hl                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 265++CEBA 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 266++CEBB 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 267++CEBD                                    ; ex      hl,de                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 268++CEBD                                    ; ld      hl,bc                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 269++CEBD                                    ; add     hl,de                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 270++CEBD 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 271++CEC0                                    ;  pop     de
 272++CEC0              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 273++CEC0 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 274++CEC1 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 275++CEC4 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 276++CEC6 32 54 9A                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 277++CEC9 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 278++CECA 32 53 9A                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 279++CECD E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 280++CED0 CD 32 CF                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 281++CED3                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 282++CED3                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 283++CED3 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 284++CED6 D5                                   push    de
 285++CED7 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 286++CED8 2A 44 CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 287++CEDB 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 288++CEDC D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 289++CEDD 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 290++CEE0 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 291++CEE1 E6 80                                and     $80
 292++CEE3 B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 293++CEE4 C8                                   ret     z
 294++CEE5 E5                                   push    hl
 295++CEE6 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 296++CEE8 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 297++CEEB B7                                   or      a
 298++CEEC ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 299++CEEE 22 53 9A                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 300++CEF1 7C                                   ld      a,h
 301++CEF2 E1                                   pop     hl
 302++CEF3 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 303++CEF6 C0                                   ret     nz
 304++CEF7              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 305++CEF7 E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 306++CEFA CD 32 CF                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 307++CEFD                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 308++CEFD                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 309++CEFD C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 310++CF00 D5                                   push    de
 311++CF01 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 312++CF02 2A 44 CD                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 313++CF05 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 314++CF06 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 315++CF09 D1                                   pop     de
 316++CF0A C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 317++CF0B
 318++CF0B
 319++CF0B              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 320++CF0B              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 321++CF0B              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 322++CF0B              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 323++CF0B 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 324++CF0C 32 53 9A                             ld      (varR),a
 325++CF0F CD 7A CF                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 326++CF12 F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 327++CF13 C5                                   push    bc
 328++CF14 47                                   ld      b,a
 329++CF15 3A 6E 9A                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 330++CF18 FE 00                                cp      0
 331++CF1A 78                                   ld      a,b
 332++CF1B C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 333++CF1C 20 23                                jr      nz, LL121
 334++CF1E              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 335++CF1E 3A 3F CD     LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 336++CF21 32 52 9A                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 337++CF24 CD B5 AA                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 338++CF27 22 44 CD                             ld      (varYX),hl
 339++CF2A F1                                   pop     af
 340++CF2B ED 27 80                             test    $80
 341++CF2E CA 6D CF                             jp      z,LL133
 342++CF31 C9                                   ret
 343++CF32              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 344++CF32              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 345++CF32              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 346++CF32              ;
 347++CF32              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 348++CF32              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 349++CF32              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 350++CF32 CD 7A CF     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 351++CF35 F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 352++CF36 C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 353++CF37 47                                   ld      b,a
 354++CF38 3A 6E 9A                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 355++CF3B FE 00                                cp      0
 356++CF3D 78                                   ld      a,b
 357++CF3E C1                                   pop     bc
 358++CF3F 20 DD                                jr      nz, LL122
 359++CF41              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 360++CF41 11 FE FF     LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 361++CF44 2A 53 9A                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 362++CF47 3A 52 9A                             ld      a,(varQ)
 363++CF4A 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 364++CF4B              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 364++CF4B CB 25       >			   sla l
 364++CF4D CB 14       >			   rl  h
 365++CF4F 7C                                   ld      a,h
 366++CF50 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 367++CF52                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 367++CF52 B8          >                        cp      b
 367++CF53 DA 5E CF    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 368++CF56 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 369++CF57 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 370++CF58 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 371++CF59 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 372++CF5A DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 373++CF5C 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 374++CF5D 3F                                   ccf
 375++CF5E              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 375++CF5E CB 13       >               rl  e
 375++CF60 CB 12       >               rl  d
 376++CF62 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 377++CF64 ED 53 44 CD                          ld      (varYX),de
 378++CF68 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 379++CF69 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 380++CF6C C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 381++CF6D 2A 44 CD     LL133:                  ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 382++CF70                                      NegHL
 382++CF70 AF          >                    xor a
 382++CF71 95          >                    sub l
 382++CF72 6F          >                    ld l,a
 382++CF73 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 382++CF74 94          >                    sub h
 382++CF75 67          >                    ld h,a
 383++CF76 22 44 CD                             ld      (varYX),hl
 384++CF79 C9           LL128:                  ret
 385++CF7A              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 386++CF7A              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 387++CF7A              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 388++CF7A              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 389++CF7A 3A 3F CD     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 390++CF7D 32 52 9A                             ld      (varQ),a                    ;Set Q = XX12+2
 391++CF80 3A 54 9A                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 392++CF83 E5 F5                                push    hl,,af
 393++CF85 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 394++CF88 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127
 395++CF8A 2A 53 9A                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; else SR = | SR|
 396++CF8D                                      NegHL
 396++CF8D AF          >                    xor a
 396++CF8E 95          >                    sub l
 396++CF8F 6F          >                    ld l,a
 396++CF90 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 396++CF91 94          >                    sub h
 396++CF92 67          >                    ld h,a
 397++CF93 22 53 9A                             ld      (varRS),hl
 398++CF96 21 40 CD     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign
 399++CF99 F1                                   pop     af
 400++CF9A AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 401++CF9B E1                                   pop     hl
 402++CF9C C9                                   ret
 403++CF9D
# file closed: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
 628+ CF9D              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 629+ CF9D                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
   1++CF9D              ; Set TransMatTo
   2++CF9D              ; XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)   = sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z XX16(13,12) (15 14) (17 16)
   3++CF9D              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)
   4++CF9D              ; XX16(13 12) (15 14) (17 16) = nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)
   5++CF9D              ; This moves Side XYZ to position 0, Roof XYZ to position 1 annd nose XYZ to position 2 as a copy of each batch of 6 bytes
   6++CF9D              CopyRotmatToTransMat:                       ; Tested
   7++CF9D 21 15 C0     LL15_CopyRotMat:        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
   8++CFA0
   9++CFA0 11 3E C0                             ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  10++CFA3                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  10++CFA3 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CFA5 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CFA7 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CFA9 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CFAB ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CFAD ED A0       >                        ldi
  11++CFAF 21 1B C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatRoofvX
  12++CFB2 11 44 C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatRoofvX
  13++CFB5                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  13++CFB5 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CFB7 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CFB9 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CFBB ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CFBD ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CFBF ED A0       >                        ldi
  14++CFC1 21 21 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatNosevX
  15++CFC4 11 4A C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatNosevX
  16++CFC7                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  16++CFC7 ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CFC9 ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CFCB ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CFCD ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CFCF ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CFD1 ED A0       >                        ldi
  17++CFD3 C9                                   ret
  18++CFD4

  20++CFD4 ~                                    ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
  21++CFD4 ~                                    ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  22++CFD4 ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  23++CFD4 ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions

  25++CFD4                                      ENDM

 630+ CFD4                                      include "./Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
   1++CFD4              TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15:
   2++CFD4 2A 89 C0             ld		hl,(UBnkXX12xLo)					; get X into HL
   3++CFD7 7C           		ld		a,h			                        ; get XX12 Sign
   4++CFD8 E6 80        		and		$80									; check sign bit on high byte
   5++CFDA 47           		ld		b,a									; and put it in of 12xlo in b
   6++CFDB                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
   7++CFDB 7C                   ld      a,h
   8++CFDC E6 7F                and     $7F
   9++CFDE 67                   ld      h,a
  10++CFDF                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  11++CFDF ED 5B 0C C0  		ld		de,(UBnKxlo)						;
  12++CFE3 3A 0E C0     		ld		a,(UBnKxsgn)						; get Ship Pos (low,high,sign)
  13++CFE6 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  14++CFE8 4F           		ld		c,a									; and put sign of unkxsgn c
  15++CFE9 CD 11 B1     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC		; this will result in HL = result and A = sign
  16++CFEC B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H to give 15 bit signed (*NOT* 2's c)
  17++CFED 67           		ld		h,a
  18++CFEE 22 83 C0     		ld		(UBnkXScaled),hl					; now write it out to XX15 X pos
  19++CFF1              ; ..................................
  20++CFF1 2A 8B C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12yLo)					; Repeat above for Y coordinate
  21++CFF4 7C           		ld		a,h
  22++CFF5 E6 80        		and		$80
  23++CFF7 47           		ld		b,a
  24++CFF8                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  25++CFF8 7C                   ld      a,h
  26++CFF9 E6 7F                and     $7F
  27++CFFB 67                   ld      h,a
  28++CFFC                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  29++CFFC ED 5B 0F C0  		ld		de,(UBnKylo)
  30++D000 3A 11 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKysgn)
  31++D003 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  32++D005 4F           		ld		c,a
  33++D006 CD 11 B1     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  34++D009 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  35++D00A 67           		ld		h,a
  36++D00B 22 85 C0     		ld		(UBnkYScaled),hl
  37++D00E              ; ..................................
  38++D00E 2A 8D C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12zLo)					; and now repeat for Z cooord
  39++D011 7C           		ld		a,h
  40++D012 E6 80        		and		$80
  41++D014 47           		ld		b,a
  42++D015                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  43++D015 7C                   ld      a,h
  44++D016 E6 7F                and     $7F
  45++D018 67                   ld      h,a
  46++D019                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  47++D019 ED 5B 12 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKzlo)
  48++D01D 3A 14 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKzsgn)
  49++D020 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  50++D022 4F           		ld		c,a
  51++D023 CD 11 B1     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  52++D026 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  53++D027 67           		ld		h,a
  54++D028 CB 7C        		bit		7,h                                 ; if sign if positive then we don't need to do the clamp so we ony jump
  55++D02A 20 16        		jr		nz,ClampZto4                        ; result was negative so we need to clamp to 4
  56++D02C E6 7F                and     $7F                                 ; a = value unsigned
  57++D02E 20 06                jr      nz,NoClampZto4                      ; if high byte was 0 then we could need to clamp still by this stage its +v but and will set z flag if high byte is zero
  58++D030 7D                   ld      a,l                                 ; get low byte now
  59++D031              		JumpIfALTNusng 4,ClampZto4					; if its < 4 then fix at 4
  59++D031 FE 04       >                        cp      4
  59++D033 DA 42 D0    >                        jp		c, ClampZto4
  60++D036              NoClampZto4:
  61++D036 22 87 C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl					; hl = signed calculation and > 4
  62++D039 7D           		ld		a,l									; in addition write out the z cooord to UT for now for backwards compat (DEBUG TODO remove later)
  63++D03A 32 6E 9A             ld      (varT),a
  64++D03D 7C           		ld		a,h
  65++D03E 32 51 9A             ld      (varU),a
  66++D041 C9           		ret
  67++D042              ClampZto4:											; This is where we limit 4 to a minimum of 4
  68++D042 21 04 00     		ld		hl,4
  69++D045 22 87 C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl; BODGE FOR NOW
  70++D048 7D           		ld		a,l
  71++D049 32 6E 9A             ld      (varT),a                            ;                                                                           ;;;
  72++D04C 7C           		ld		a,h
  73++D04D 32 51 9A             ld      (varU),a 						; compatibility for now
  74++D050 C9           		ret
  75++D051
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
 631+ D051                                      include "./Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm"
# file opened: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm
   1++D051              ScaleNodeTo8Bit:								; TODO make signed
   2++D051 ED 4B 87 C0  	ld			bc,(UBnkZScaled)
   3++D055 2A 83 C0     	ld			hl,(UBnkXScaled)
   4++D058 ED 5B 85 C0  	ld			de,(UBnkYScaled)
   5++D05C              SetABSbc:
   6++D05C 78           	ld			a,b
   7++D05D DD 67        	ld			ixh,a
   8++D05F E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
   9++D061 47           	ld			b,a									; bc = ABS bc
  10++D062              SetABShl:
  11++D062 7C           	ld			a,h
  12++D063 DD 6F        	ld			ixl,a
  13++D065 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  14++D067 67           	ld			h,a									; hl = ABS hl
  15++D068              SetABSde:
  16++D068 7A           	ld			a,d
  17++D069 FD 67        	ld			iyh,a
  18++D06B E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  19++D06D 57           	ld			d,a									; de = ABS de
  20++D06E              ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop:
  21++D06E 78               ld          a,b		                            ; U	\ z hi
  22++D06F B4           	or			h                                   ; XX15+1	\ x hi
  23++D070 B2           	or			d                                   ; XX15+4	\ y hi
  24++D071 28 0F            jr          z,ScaleNodeDone                   ; if X, Y, Z = 0  exit loop down once hi U rolled to 0
  25++D073                  ShiftHLRight1
  25++D073 CB 3C       >			   srl h
  25++D075 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
  26++D077                  ShiftDERight1
  26++D077 CB 3A       >			   srl d
  26++D079 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
  27++D07B              	ShiftBCRight1
  27++D07B CB 38       >			   srl b
  27++D07D CB 19       >			   rr  c
  28++D07F C3 6E D0         jp          ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop
  29++D082              ScaleNodeDone:										; now we have scaled values we have to deal with sign
  30++D082 DD 7C        	ld			a,ixh								; get sign bit and or with b
  31++D084 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  32++D086 B0           	or			b
  33++D087 47           	ld			b,a
  34++D088              SignforHL:
  35++D088 DD 7D        	ld			a,ixl								; get sign bit and or with b
  36++D08A E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  37++D08C B4           	or			h
  38++D08D 67           	ld			h,a
  39++D08E              SignforDE:
  40++D08E FD 7C        	ld			a,iyh								; get sign bit and or with b
  41++D090 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  42++D092 B2           	or			d
  43++D093 57           	ld			d,a
  44++D094              SignsDoneSaveResult:
  45++D094 ED 43 87 C0  	ld			(UBnkZScaled),bc
  46++D098 22 83 C0     	ld			(UBnkXScaled),hl
  47++D09B ED 53 85 C0  	ld			(UBnkYScaled),de
  48++D09F 78           	ld			a,b
  49++D0A0 32 51 9A     	ld			(varU),a
  50++D0A3 79           	ld			a,c
  51++D0A4 32 6E 9A     	ld			(varT),a
  52++D0A7 C9           	ret
  53++D0A8
# file closed: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm

 639+ D0B1              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 641+ D0B4 ED 31                                add     hl,a
 642+ D0B6 AF                                   xor     a
 643+ D0B7 77                                   ld      (hl),a
 644+ D0B8 C9                                   ret

 646+ D0B9 3A 18 C3     SetAllFacesVisible:     ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+FaceCtX4Addr                                 ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity

 648+ D0BE CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4  TODO add this into blueprint data for speed                                                           ;;; For loop = 15 to 0

 651+ D0C4 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF
 652+ D0C6              SetAllFacesVisibleLoop:

 654+ D0C7 23                                   inc     hl
 655+ D0C8 10 FC                                djnz    SetAllFacesVisibleLoop
 656+ D0CA C9                                   ret
 657+ D0CB              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 658+ D0CB 3A 18 C3     SetAllFacesHidden:      ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+ShipHullFacesCount                           ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 659+ D0CE CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 660+ D0D0 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4                                                                                  ;;; For loop = 15 to 0
 661+ D0D2 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = Xreg = number of normals, faces
 662+ D0D3 06 10                                ld      b,16
 663+ D0D5 21 B0 C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 664+ D0D8 3E 00                                ld      a,$00
 665+ D0DA 77           SetAllFacesHiddenLoop:  ld      (hl),a
 666+ D0DB 23                                   inc     hl
 667+ D0DC 10 FC                                djnz    SetAllFacesHiddenLoop

 674+ D0DF              ;;;;  Loop                                              ::LL90

 677+ D0DF              ;;;;  Until ZtempHi = 0
 678+ D0DF              ;;;;......................................................
 679+ D0DF              ;-LL21---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 680+ D0DF                                      include "Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
   1++D0DF              ;divdide by 16 using undocumented instrunctions
   2++D0DF              Norm256mulAdivQ:
   3++D0DF 47               ld      b,a
   4++D0E0 0E 00            ld      c,0
   5++D0E2 16 00            ld      d,0
   6++D0E4 3A 52 9A         ld      a,(varQ)
   7++D0E7 5F               ld      e,a
   8++D0E8              ;Input: BC = Dividend, DE = Divisor, HL = 0
   9++D0E8              ;Output: BC = Quotient, HL = Remainder
  10++D0E8              NormDIV16UNDOC:
  11++D0E8 21 00 00         ld      hl,0
  12++D0EB 78               ld      a,b
  13++D0EC 06 10            ld      b,16
  14++D0EE              NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP:
  15++D0EE CB 31        	sll	    c		; unroll 16 times
  16++D0F0 17           	rla	    		; ...
  17++D0F1 ED 6A        	adc	    hl,hl		; ...
  18++D0F3 ED 52        	sbc	    hl,de		; ...
  19++D0F5 30 02        	jr	    nc,NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP		; ...
  20++D0F7 19           	add	    hl,de		; ...
  21++D0F8 0D           	dec	    c		; ...
  22++D0F9              NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP:
  23++D0F9 10 F3            djnz    NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP
  24++D0FB 79               ld      a,c
  25++D0FC 32 53 9A         ld      (varR),a
  26++D0FF C9               ret
  27++D100
  28++D100              ; Tested OK
  29++D100              NormaliseTransMat:
  30++D100              ;LL21
  31++D100 21 4F C0             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+1         ; initialise loop
  32++D103 0E C5                ld      c,ConstNorm                 ; c = Q = norm = 197
  33++D105 79                   ld      a,c
  34++D106 32 52 9A             ld      (varQ),a                    ; set up varQ
  35++D109 06 09                ld      b,9                         ; total of 9 elements to transform
  36++D10B              LL21Loop:
  37++D10B 56                   ld      d,(hl)
  38++D10C 2B                   dec     hl
  39++D10D 5E                   ld      e,(hl)                      ; de = hilo now   hl now = pointer to low byte
  40++D10E                      ShiftDELeft1                        ; De = DE * 2
  40++D10E CB 23       >			   sla e
  40++D110 CB 12       >			   rl  d
  41++D112 7A                   ld      a,d                         ; a = hi byte after shifting
  42++D113 E5           		push	hl
  43++D114 C5           		push	bc
  44++D115 CD DF D0             call    Norm256mulAdivQ
  45++D118              		;===call    RequAmul256divC				; R = (2(hi).0)/ConstNorm - LL28 Optimised BFRDIV R=A*256/Q = delta_y / delta_x Use Y/X grad. as not steep
  46++D118 79                   ld      a,c                         ; BFRDIV returns R also in l reg
  47++D119 C1           		pop		bc
  48++D11A E1           		pop		hl							; bc gets wrecked by BFRDIV
  49++D11B 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; write low result to low byte so zlo = (zhl *2)/197, we keep hi byte in tact as we need the sign bit
  50++D11C 2B                   dec     hl                          ; now hl = hi byte of pre val e.g z->y->x
  51++D11D 10 EC                djnz    LL21Loop                    ; loop from 2zLo through to 0xLo
  52++D11F C9                   ret
  53++D120
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
 681+ D120              ;-LL91---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 682+ D120
 683+ D120              ; Now we have
 684+ D120              ;   * XX18(2 1 0) = (x_sign x_hi x_lo)
 685+ D120              ;   * XX18(5 4 3) = (y_sign y_hi y_lo)
 686+ D120              ;   * XX18(8 7 6) = (z_sign z_hi z_lo)
 687+ D120              ;
 688+ D120              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 689+ D120                                      include "Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
   1++D120              ; TESTEDOK
   2++D120
   3++D120              ;ScaleOrientationXX16:                       ; DEBUG TODO will combine with inverse later
   4++D120              ;        ld      a,(XX17)
   5++D120              ;        ld      ixl,a
   6++D120              ;        ld      ixh,9
   7++D120              ;        ld      hl,UBnkTransInv0x
   8++D120              ;        ld      a,(hl)
   9++D120              ;ScaleNode:
  10++D120              ;        ld      b,ixl
  11++D120              ;ScaleNodeLoop:
  12++D120              ;        sla      a
  13++D120              ;        djnz    ScaleNodeLoop
  14++D120              ;        ld      (hl),a
  15++D120              ;        inc     hl
  16++D120              ;        inc     hl
  17++D120              ;        dec     ixh
  18++D120              ;        jr      nz,ScaleNode
  19++D120              ;        ret
  20++D120
  21++D120
  22++D120              InverseXX16:								; lead routine into .LL42	\ ->  &4B04 \ DO nodeX-Ycoords their comment  \  TrnspMat
  23++D120              ; we coudl combine this with move to transmat later as an optimisation
  24++D120              ; INPUT - All Scaled
  25++D120              ;  They transmat has already been put into side, roof nose order
  26++D120              ;  XX16   = |sidev_x| |sidev_y| |sidev_z|  1  0  3  2  5  4 note each bytepair is Scaled value in low and high byte just for sign
  27++D120              ;  XX16   = |roofv_x| |roofv_y| |roofv_z|  7  6  8  9 11 10
  28++D120              ;  XX16   = |nosev_x| |nosev_y| |nosev_z| 13 12 15 14 17 16
  29++D120              ; OUTPUT
  30++D120              ;  XX16(1 0)   ( 3 2) ( 5 4 ) =  sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x
  31++D120              ;  XX16(7 6)   ( 8 9) (11 10) =  sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y
  32++D120              ;  XX16(13 12) (15 14)(17 16) =  sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z
  33++D120              ; First all side values become compoment 0 of each vector
  34++D120 2A 3E C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevX)     ;
  35++D123 ED 5B 44 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvX)     ;
  36++D127 ED 4B 4A C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevX)     ;
  37++D12B 22 56 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x0),hl     ;
  38++D12E ED 53 58 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x1),de     ;
  39++D132 ED 43 5A C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x2),bc     ;
  40++D136 2A 40 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevY)     ;
  41++D139 ED 5B 46 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvY)     ;
  42++D13D ED 4B 4C C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevY)     ;
  43++D141 22 5E C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y0),hl     ;
  44++D144 ED 53 60 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y1),de     ;
  45++D148 ED 43 62 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y2),bc     ;
  46++D14C 2A 42 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevZ)     ;
  47++D14F ED 5B 48 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvZ)     ;
  48++D153 ED 4B 4E C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevZ)     ;
  49++D157 22 66 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z0),hl     ;
  50++D15A ED 53 68 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z1),de     ;
  51++D15E ED 43 6A C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z2),bc     ;
  52++D162 C9                   ret
  53++D163
  54++D163
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
 690+ D163              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 691+ D163              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 692+ D163              ;   XX12(1 0) = [x y z] . sidev  = (dot_sidev_sign dot_sidev_lo)  = dot_sidev
 693+ D163              ;   XX12(3 2) = [x y z] . roofv  = (dot_roofv_sign dot_roofv_lo)  = dot_roofv
 694+ D163              ;   XX12(5 4) = [x y z] . nosev  = (dot_nosev_sign dot_nosev_lo)  = dot_nosev
 695+ D163              ; Returns
 696+ D163              ;
 697+ D163              ;   XX12(1 0)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the sidev (or _x)
 698+ D163              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+1 and magnitude in XX12
 699+ D163              ;
 700+ D163              ;   XX12(3 2)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the roofv (or _y)
 701+ D163              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+3 and magnitude in XX12+2
 702+ D163              ;
 703+ D163              ;   XX12(5 4)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the nosev (or _z)
 704+ D163              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+5 and magnitude in XX12+4
 705+ D163              XXCURRENTN0equN1byN2div256: MACRO param1, param2, param3
 706+ D163 ~                                    ld      c,0
 707+ D163 ~                                    ld      a,param3                      ;
 708+ D163 ~                                    bit     7,a
 709+ D163 ~                                    jr      z,.val2Pos
 710+ D163 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 711+ D163 ~                                    neg
 712+ D163 ~                                    ld      c,$80
 713+ D163 ~            .val2Pos:               ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 714+ D163 ~                                    ld      a,param2                        ; A = XX16 element
 715+ D163 ~                                    bit     7,a
 716+ D163 ~                                    jr      z,.val1Pos
 717+ D163 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 718+ D163 ~                                    neg
 719+ D163 ~                                    ld      b,a
 720+ D163 ~                                    ld      a,c
 721+ D163 ~                                    xor     $80
 722+ D163 ~                                    ld      c,a
 723+ D163 ~                                    ld      a,b
 724+ D163 ~            .val1Pos:               ld      d,a
 725+ D163 ~            ;AequAmulQdiv256:
 726+ D163 ~                                    mul
 727+ D163 ~                                    ld      a,c
 728+ D163 ~                                    bit     7,a
 729+ D163 ~                                    ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 730+ D163 ~                                    jr      z,.resultPos
 731+ D163 ~                                    neg
 732+ D163 ~            .resultPos:             ld      (param1),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 733+ D163                                      ENDM
 734+ D163
 735+ D163
 736+ D163               ; TESTEDOK
 737+ D163              XX12DotOneRow:
 738+ D163              XX12CalcX:              N0equN1byN2div256 varT, (hl), (UBnkXScaled)       ; T = (hl) * regXX15fx /256
 738+ D163 3A 83 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaled)                        ;
 738+ D166 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 738+ D167 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 738+ D168 57          >                        ld      d,a
 738+ D169 ED 30       >                        mul
 738+ D16B 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 738+ D16C 32 6E 9A    >                        ld      (varT),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 739+ D16F 23                                   inc     hl                                  ; move to sign byte
 740+ D170              XX12CalcXSign:          AequN1xorN2 UBnkXScaledSign,(hl)             ;
 740+ D170 3A 84 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaledSign)
 740+ D173 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 741+ D174 32 54 9A                             ld      (varS),a                            ; Set S to the sign of x_sign * sidev_x
 742+ D177 23                                   inc     hl
 743+ D178              XX12CalcY:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ, (hl),(UBnkYScaled)       ; Q = XX16 * XX15 /256 using varQ to hold regXX15fx
 743+ D178 3A 85 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaled)                        ;
 743+ D17B 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 743+ D17C 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 743+ D17D 57          >                        ld      d,a
 743+ D17E ED 30       >                        mul
 743+ D180 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 743+ D181 32 52 9A    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 744+ D184                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = T =  |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256
 744+ D184 3A 6E 9A    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 744+ D187 32 53 9A    >                        ld       (varR),a
 745+ D18A 23                                   inc     hl
 746+ D18B                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkYScaledSign,(hl)             ; Set A to the sign of y_sign * sidev_y
 746+ D18B 3A 86 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaledSign)
 746+ D18E AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 747+ D18F              ; (S)A = |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256  = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 748+ D18F E5           STequSRplusAQ           push    hl
 749+ D190 CD 2F B2                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ 1byte add (subtract)
 750+ D193 E1                                   pop     hl
 751+ D194 32 6E 9A                             ld      (varT),a                            ; T = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 752+ D197 23                                   inc     hl
 753+ D198              XX12CalcZ:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ,(hl),(UBnkZScaled)       ; Q = |sidev_z| * z_lo / 256
 753+ D198 3A 87 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                        ;
 753+ D19B 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 753+ D19C 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 753+ D19D 57          >                        ld      d,a
 753+ D19E ED 30       >                        mul
 753+ D1A0 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 753+ D1A1 32 52 9A    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 754+ D1A4                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 754+ D1A4 3A 6E 9A    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 754+ D1A7 32 53 9A    >                        ld       (varR),a
 755+ D1AA 23                                   inc     hl
 756+ D1AB                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkZScaledSign,(hl)             ; A = sign of z_sign * sidev_z
 756+ D1AB 3A 88 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)
 756+ D1AE AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 757+ D1AF              ; (S)A= |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo + |sidev_z| * z_lo
 758+ D1AF CD 2F B2                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA)   \ 1byte add (subtract)
 759+ D1B2              ; Now we exit with A = result S = Sign
 760+ D1B2 C9                                   ret
 761+ D1B3
 762+ D1B3
 763+ D1B3              ;-- LL51---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 764+ D1B3              ;TESTED OK
 765+ D1B3              XX12EquXX15DotProductXX16:
 766+ D1B3              XX12EquScaleDotOrientation:                         ; .LL51 \ -> &4832 \ XX12=XX15.XX16  each vector is 16-bit x,y,z
 767+ D1B3 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                                ; LDX, LDY 0
 768+ D1B6 21 3E C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatSidevX
 769+ D1B9 CD 63 D1                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 770+ D1BC 32 89 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xLo),a
 771+ D1BF 3A 54 9A                             ld      a,(varS)
 772+ D1C2 32 8A C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xSign),a
 773+ D1C5 21 44 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatRoofvX
 774+ D1C8 CD 63 D1                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 775+ D1CB 32 8B C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12yLo),a
 776+ D1CE 3A 54 9A                             ld      a,(varS)
 777+ D1D1 32 8C C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12ySign),a
 778+ D1D4 21 4A C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevX
 779+ D1D7 CD 63 D1                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 780+ D1DA 32 8D C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zLo),a
 781+ D1DD 3A 54 9A                             ld      a,(varS)
 782+ D1E0 32 8E C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zSign),a
 783+ D1E3 C9                                   ret
 784+ D1E4              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 785+ D1E4                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm
   1++D1E4              CopyXX12ScaledToXX18:
   2++D1E4              CopyResultToDrawCam:

   7++D1FC 3A 8D C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+4)

   1++D253 21 0C C0     LoadCraftToCamera:      ld      hl,UBnKxlo
